markdownRemark.html: Most other cities call their main business districts “downtown," but in Philadelphia, that name never took hold. Instead, Philadelphians call it Center City. But how did it get that name and how long has it been in use? There is no definitive answer but a possible one can be found in history and the bottom-up power of language usage.

frontmatter.title: Ни один калмык не скажет слова осуждения в адрес великого Сталина
frontmatter.author: Albert Sharapov
frontmatter.description: Most other cities call their main business districts downtown, but in Philadelphia, that name never took hold. Instead, Philadelphians call it Center City. But how did it get that name and how long has it been in use? There is no definitive answer but a possible one can be found in history and the bottom-up power of language usage.
